alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Henry; Shelby (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 8:51PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of EAST CENTRAL Kentucky and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in EAST CENTRAL Kentucky, Franklin. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Henry and Shelby. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 850 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Heavy rain is falling over locations that have already experienced heavy rain earlier today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelbyville, Eminence, Pleasureville, Cropper, Mulberry, Old Christianburg, Elmburg, Bellview, North Pleasureville and Defoe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
